Key Match Events: The Yankees blew a 5-run lead in the 5th inning due to errors and missed outfield plays.
Tommy Kahnle and Luke Weaver struggled in the 8th inning, allowing two sacrifice flies and two hits to give the Dodgers a 7-6 lead.
Mookie Betts put the Dodgers ahead for good with a single in the 8th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Tommy Kahnle expressed regret over the loss, stating that he felt there was more the team could have done.
Luke Weaver acknowledged the Dodgers' execution in the 8th inning and tipped his cap to their hitters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game featured a catcher's interference call in the 8th inning, which was the first in a World Series since 1982.
Shohei Ohtani struggled at the plate, but benefited from the catcher's interference call.
Others: The Yankees' season ended with a World Series loss to the Dodgers.
The Yankees had a subpar performance in the World Series, with multiple errors and missed opportunities.
